doc.title: CONSENSUS

description.text: Identification of consensus patterns in unaligned DNA and protein sequences

doc.reference: G.Z. Hertz and G.D. Stormo. Identification of consensus patterns in unaligned DNA and protein sequences: a large-deviation statistical basis for penalizing gaps. In: Proceedings of the Third International Conference on Bioinformatics and Genome Research (H.A. Lim, and C.R. Cantor, editors). World Scientific Publishing Co., Ltd. Singapore, 1995. pages 201--216.

interface.label: Program to run Search for fixed width patterns (consensus) Same as consensus, width not fixed (wconsensus)

label.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.label: Width of pattern for consensus program (-L)

label.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.label:
Number of standard deviations to lower the information content at each position before identifying information peaks for wconsensus program (-s)?
A range of values should be tried. For example, try values of 0.5, 1, 1.5, and 2. The overall best alignment is the one having the smallest e-value.
Choose an alphabet Choose an alphabet DNA Protein Users file

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Each line contains a letter (a symbol in the alphabet) followed by an optional normalization number (default: 1.0). The normalization is based on the relative prior probabilities of the letters. For nucleic acids, this might be the genomic frequency of the bases; however, if the -d option is not used, the frequencies observed in your own sequence data are used. In nucleic acid alphabets, a letter and its complement appear on the same line, separated by a colon (a letter can be its own complement, e.g. when using a dimer alphabet).

Complementary letters may use the same normalization number. Only the standard 26 letters are permissible; however, when the -CS option is used, the alphabet is case sensitive so that a total of 52 different characters are possible.
POSSIBLE LINE FORMATS WITHOUT COMPLEMENTARY LETTERS:
letter
letter normalization
POSSIBLE LINE FORMATS WITH COMPLEMENTARY LETTERS:
letter:complement
letter:complement normalization
letter:complement normalization:complement's_normalization

xhtml:div.label:
Use the designated prior probabilities of the letters to override the observed frequencies (-d)?
Yes No
By default, the program uses the frequencies observed in your own sequence data for the prior probabilities of the letters. However, if the -d option is set, the prior probabilities designated by the alphabet options. If the -d option is not set, they are still used to determine the sequence alphabet, but any prior probability information is ignored.

Complement of nucleic acid sequences (-c) Ignore the complementary strand (0) Include both strands as separate sequences (1) Include both strands as a single sequence (2) Assume that the pattern is symmetrical (consensus program only) (3)

How many words per matrix for each sequence to contribute?
No repeat Allow each sequence to contribute zero or more words per matrix (-n) Allow each sequence to contribute one or more words per matrix (-N)
-n integer: repeat the matrix building cycle a maximum of "integer" times and allow each sequence to contribute zero or more words per matrix.
-N integer: repeat the matrix building cycle a maximum of "integer" times and allow each sequence to contribute one or more words per matrix
Maximum repeat of the matrix building cycle for -n or -N
Maximum number of matrices to save between cycles of the program (-q)

Minimum distance between the starting points of words within the same matrix pattern (-m)?
The minimum distance between the starting points of words within the same matrix pattern; must be a positive integer; can only be used when the "-n" or "-N" option is also used.
For wconsensus, the default value is 1.
For consensus, this number is indicated by the width (-L).

Terminate the program this number of cycles after the current most significant alignment is identified (-t)?
default: terminate only when the maximum number of matrix building cycles is completed.

Save the top progeny matrices?
Regardless of parentage (-pr1) For each parental matrix (-pr2)
-pr2 option prevents a strong pattern found in only a subset of the sequences from overwhelming the algorithm and eliminating other potential patterns. This undesirable situation can occur when a subset of the sequences share an evolutionary relationship not common to the majority of the sequences.

Seed with the first sequence and proceed linearly through the list (-l)?
Yes No
This option results in a significant speed up in the program, but the algorithm becomes dependent on the order of the sequence-file names.
Permit terminal gaps for wconsensus program Do NOT permit terminal gaps (-pg0) Permit penalized terminal gaps (-pg1)

Number of top matrices to print (-pt)?
A negative value means print all the top matrices.

Number of final matrices to print (-pf)?
Default when NOT using -n or -N option: print 4 matrices; default when using -n or -N option: print no matrices.

div.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.
This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: A range of values should be tried. For example, try values of 0.5, 1, 1.5, and 2. The overall best alignment is the one having the smallest e-value.

Each line contains a letter (a symbol in the alphabet) followed by an optional normalization number (default: 1.0). The normalization is based on the relative prior probabilities of the letters. For nucleic acids, this might be the genomic frequency of the bases; however, if the -d option is not used, the frequencies observed in your own sequence data are used. In nucleic acid alphabets, a letter and its complement appear on the same line, separated by a colon (a letter can be its own complement, e.g. when using a dimer alphabet).

Complementary letters may use the same normalization number. Only the standard 26 letters are permissible; however, when the -CS option is used, the alphabet is case sensitive so that a total of 52 different characters are possible.
POSSIBLE LINE FORMATS WITHOUT COMPLEMENTARY LETTERS:
letter
letter normalization
POSSIBLE LINE FORMATS WITH COMPLEMENTARY LETTERS:
letter:complement
letter:complement normalization
letter:complement normalization:complement's_normalization

By default, the program uses the frequencies observed in your own sequence data for the prior probabilities of the letters. However, if the -d option is set, the prior probabilities designated by the alphabet options. If the -d option is not set, they are still used to determine the sequence alphabet, but any prior probability information is ignored.
-n integer: repeat the matrix building cycle a maximum of "integer" times and allow each sequence to contribute zero or more words per matrix.
-N integer: repeat the matrix building cycle a maximum of "integer" times and allow each sequence to contribute one or more words per matrix
The minimum distance between the starting points of words within the same matrix pattern; must be a positive integer; can only be used when the "-n" or "-N" option is also used.
For wconsensus, the default value is 1.
For consensus, this number is indicated by the width (-L).
default: terminate only when the maximum number of matrix building cycles is completed.

-pr2 option prevents a strong pattern found in only a subset of the sequences from overwhelming the algorithm and eliminating other potential patterns. This undesirable situation can occur when a subset of the sequences share an evolutionary relationship not common to the majority of the sequences.
This option results in a significant speed up in the program, but the algorithm becomes dependent on the order of the sequence-file names.
A negative value means print all the top matrices.
Default when NOT using -n or -N option: print 4 matrices; default when using -n or -N option: print no matrices.

parameter.name: prog
parameter.prompt: Program to run

velem.label: Same as consensus, width not fixed (wconsensus)

interface.label: Program to run Search for fixed width patterns (consensus) Same as consensus, width not fixed (wconsensus)

parameter.name: sequence
parameter.prompt: Sequences file (-f)

parameter.name: width
parameter.prompt: Width of pattern for consensus program (-L)

interface.label: Width of pattern for consensus program (-L)

div.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

parameter.name: standard_deviation
parameter.prompt: Number of standard deviations to lower the information content at each position before identifying information peaks for wconsensus program (-s)

comment.text: A range of values should be tried. For example, try values of 0.5, 1, 1.5, and 2. The overall best alignment is the one having the smallest e-value.

interface.label:
Number of standard deviations to lower the information content at each position before identifying information peaks for wconsensus program (-s)?
A range of values should be tried. For example, try values of 0.5, 1, 1.5, and 2. The overall best alignment is the one having the smallest e-value.

div.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: A range of values should be tried. For example, try values of 0.5, 1, 1.5, and 2. The overall best alignment is the one having the smallest e-value.

parameter.name: alphabet
parameter.prompt: Choose an alphabet

message.text: For 'User file' choice: A user alphabet file is mandatory

ctrl.code: ($value eq "users" and not defined $ascii_alphabet) or ($value eq "prot-alphabet" or $value eq "dna-alphabet" or $value eq "null")
(value == "users" and ascii_alphabet is not None) or (value in ("prot-alphabet","dna-alphabet", "null") )

interface.label: Choose an alphabet Choose an alphabet DNA Protein Users file

parameter.name: ascii_alphabet
parameter.prompt: User Alphabet file (-a)

comment.text: Each line contains a letter (a symbol in the alphabet) followed by an optional normalization number (default: 1.0). The normalization is based on the relative prior probabilities of the letters. For nucleic acids, this might be the genomic frequency of the bases; however, if the -d option is not used, the frequencies observed in your own sequence data are used. In nucleic acid alphabets, a letter and its complement appear on the same line, separated by a colon (a letter can be its own complement, e.g. when using a dimer alphabet).

Complementary letters may use the same normalization number. Only the standard 26 letters are permissible; however, when the -CS option is used, the alphabet is case sensitive so that a total of 52 different characters are possible.
POSSIBLE LINE FORMATS WITHOUT COMPLEMENTARY LETTERS:
letter
letter normalization
POSSIBLE LINE FORMATS WITH COMPLEMENTARY LETTERS:
letter:complement
letter:complement normalization
letter:complement normalization:complement's_normalization

Complementary letters may use the same normalization number. Only the standard 26 letters are permissible; however, when the -CS option is used, the alphabet is case sensitive so that a total of 52 different characters are possible.

parameter.name: prior
parameter.prompt: Use the designated prior probabilities of the letters to override the observed frequencies (-d)

comment.text: By default, the program uses the frequencies observed in your own sequence data for the prior probabilities of the letters. However, if the -d option is set, the prior probabilities designated by the alphabet options. If the -d option is not set, they are still used to determine the sequence alphabet, but any prior probability information is ignored.

interface.label:
Use the designated prior probabilities of the letters to override the observed frequencies (-d)?
Yes No
By default, the program uses the frequencies observed in your own sequence data for the prior probabilities of the letters. However, if the -d option is set, the prior probabilities designated by the alphabet options. If the -d option is not set, they are still used to determine the sequence alphabet, but any prior probability information is ignored.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: By default, the program uses the frequencies observed in your own sequence data for the prior probabilities of the letters. However, if the -d option is set, the prior probabilities designated by the alphabet options. If the -d option is not set, they are still used to determine the sequence alphabet, but any prior probability information is ignored.

parameter.name: complement
parameter.prompt: Complement of nucleic acid sequences (-c)

velem.label: Include both strands as separate sequences (1)
Include both strands as a single sequence (2)
Assume that the pattern is symmetrical (consensus program only) (3)

format.code: ( "" , " -c" + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

message.text: Symmetrical pattern (3) is for the consensus program only

ctrl.code: ($value eq "3" and $prog eq "consensus") or ($value eq "0" or $value eq "1" or $value eq "2" )
(value == "3" and prog == "consensus") or (value == "0" or value == "1" or value == "2" )

interface.label: Complement of nucleic acid sequences (-c) Ignore the complementary strand (0) Include both strands as separate sequences (1) Include both strands as a single sequence (2) Assume that the pattern is symmetrical (consensus program only) (3)

parameter.name: max_cycle
parameter.prompt: How many words per matrix for each sequence to contribute

velem.label: Allow each sequence to contribute zero or more words per matrix (-n)
Allow each sequence to contribute one or more words per matrix (-N)

message.text: For the -n/-N option, you must define a Maximum repeat of the matrix building cycle.

ctrl.code: (value == "-n" or value =="-N") and max_cycle_nb is not None

comment.text: -n integer: repeat the matrix building cycle a maximum of "integer" times and allow each sequence to contribute zero or more words per matrix.
-N integer: repeat the matrix building cycle a maximum of "integer" times and allow each sequence to contribute one or more words per matrix

interface.label:
How many words per matrix for each sequence to contribute?
No repeat Allow each sequence to contribute zero or more words per matrix (-n) Allow each sequence to contribute one or more words per matrix (-N)
-n integer: repeat the matrix building cycle a maximum of "integer" times and allow each sequence to contribute zero or more words per matrix.
-N integer: repeat the matrix building cycle a maximum of "integer" times and allow each sequence to contribute one or more words per matrix

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: -n integer: repeat the matrix building cycle a maximum of "integer" times and allow each sequence to contribute zero or more words per matrix.
-N integer: repeat the matrix building cycle a maximum of "integer" times and allow each sequence to contribute one or more words per matrix

parameter.name: max_cycle_nb
parameter.prompt: Maximum repeat of the matrix building cycle for -n or -N

interface.label: Maximum repeat of the matrix building cycle for -n or -N

parameter.name: queue
parameter.prompt: Maximum number of matrices to save between cycles of the program (-q)

interface.label: Maximum number of matrices to save between cycles of the program (-q)

parameter.name: distance
parameter.prompt: Minimum distance between the starting points of words within the same matrix pattern (-m)

format.code: ( "" , " -m" + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

message.text: The value must be positive and this option can only be used when the "-n" or "-N" option is also used.

comment.text: The minimum distance between the starting points of words within the same matrix pattern; must be a positive integer; can only be used when the "-n" or "-N" option is also used.
For wconsensus, the default value is 1.
For consensus, this number is indicated by the width (-L).

interface.label:
Minimum distance between the starting points of words within the same matrix pattern (-m)?
The minimum distance between the starting points of words within the same matrix pattern; must be a positive integer; can only be used when the "-n" or "-N" option is also used.
For wconsensus, the default value is 1.
For consensus, this number is indicated by the width (-L).

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The minimum distance between the starting points of words within the same matrix pattern; must be a positive integer; can only be used when the "-n" or "-N" option is also used.
For wconsensus, the default value is 1.
For consensus, this number is indicated by the width (-L).

parameter.name: terminate
parameter.prompt: Terminate the program this number of cycles after the current most significant alignment is identified (-t)

comment.text: default: terminate only when the maximum number of matrix building cycles is completed.

interface.label:
Terminate the program this number of cycles after the current most significant alignment is identified (-t)?
default: terminate only when the maximum number of matrix building cycles is completed.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: default: terminate only when the maximum number of matrix building cycles is completed.

parameter.name: progeny
parameter.prompt: Save the top progeny matrices

format.code: ( "" , " " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

comment.text: -pr2 option prevents a strong pattern found in only a subset of the sequences from overwhelming the algorithm and eliminating other potential patterns. This undesirable situation can occur when a subset of the sequences share an evolutionary relationship not common to the majority of the sequences.

interface.label:
Save the top progeny matrices?
Regardless of parentage (-pr1) For each parental matrix (-pr2)
-pr2 option prevents a strong pattern found in only a subset of the sequences from overwhelming the algorithm and eliminating other potential patterns. This undesirable situation can occur when a subset of the sequences share an evolutionary relationship not common to the majority of the sequences.

parameter.name: linearly
parameter.prompt: Seed with the first sequence and proceed linearly through the list (-l)

message.text: The -l and -n option are mutually exclusive

comment.text: This option results in a significant speed up in the program, but the algorithm becomes dependent on the order of the sequence-file names.

interface.label:
Seed with the first sequence and proceed linearly through the list (-l)?
Yes No
This option results in a significant speed up in the program, but the algorithm becomes dependent on the order of the sequence-file names.

parameter.name: terminal_gap
parameter.prompt: Permit terminal gaps for wconsensus program

format.code: ( "" , " " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

interface.label: Permit terminal gaps for wconsensus program Do NOT permit terminal gaps (-pg0) Permit penalized terminal gaps (-pg1)

parameter.name: top_matrices
parameter.prompt: Number of top matrices to print (-pt)

format.code: ( "" , " -pt" + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

comment.text: A negative value means print all the top matrices.

interface.label:
Number of top matrices to print (-pt)?
A negative value means print all the top matrices.

parameter.name: final_matrices

Number of final matrices to print (-pf)?
Default when NOT using -n or -N option: print 4 matrices; default when using -n or -N option: print no matrices.
